revised_title: Electrification of Linear Flexible-Chain Polymers: A Study on Molecular Mass and Flow Parameters
tldr: This study investigates the static electrification of linear flexible-chain polymers, specifically 1,4-polybutadienes, as they are extruded through metal and dielectric ducts above the glass transition temperature. The research focuses on the effects of molecular mass, molecular mass distribution, temperature, sliding velocity, and duct length on the electrification process. The findings provide insights into the factors responsible for electrification and the influence of polymer straining conditions, duct material, and dimensions on the process.
